name: Greenboard
headline: 'Rippling' for Financial Compliance and Operations
description:
Greenboard is building a singular, AI-powered platform to handle management of the entirety of financial firms’ compliance programs, and eventually all back office processes. Today, financial institutions use Greenboard to detect risk using AI and to rip out and replace the bad legacy back office tooling they have wanted to get rid of for years.

Greenboard's mission is to enable financial institutions to operate their back office teams at a higher standard, with half of the headcount. We’re starting with compliance

founders.name: Dave Feldman, Founder
founders.description:
Prior to founding Greenboard, Dave worked in Product at Guideline, where he led teams that built core systems including Guideline’s financial recordkeeping engine. Before that, Dave led Hive AI’s joint venture with Bain & Company.

Dave holds a BS in Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering and an MS in Computer Science from Johns Hopkins University. In his spare time, Dave is an avid outdoorsman who enjoys hiking, sailing, and downhill skiing.

founders.name: Edward Schembor, Founder
founders.description: Before Greenboard, Ed led Product for Amazon's search navigation experience and worked on the founding Amazon Fashion catalog team. Before that, Ed worked as an engineer scaling Amazon's email-based product recommendation systems and on the internal machine learning team that eventually went on to become AWS Sagemaker. Ed holds a BS in Computer Science from Johns Hopkins University. Outside of work, Ed boulders and explores the NYC food scene.

generated_description:
### Greenboard: Streamlining Financial Compliance

Founded in 2023 and currently part of Y Combinator’s Batch W24, Greenboard is on a mission to revolutionize the way financial institutions handle compliance and back-office operations. At its core, Greenboard is building a singular, AI-powered platform designed to manage the entirety of a financial firm's compliance programs and significantly improve back-office efficiency.

Their approach is straightforward: **Rippling for Financial Compliance and Operations**. This means they’re focused on making compliance seamless and intuitive, allowing firms to operate at higher standards while simultaneously reducing headcount—by as much as half. Imagine a world where financial firms can ditch their clunky, outdated legacy tools and replace them with smart, interconnected systems that utilize cutting-edge AI to detect risk and enhance reporting.

Greenboard caters specifically to the needs of compliance within financial institutions. Their suite of products includes tools for communications archiving, risk assessment, and vendor compliance management, among others. Notably, they are aiming to create compliance solutions that are so effective that choosing anything else would be considered negligent—high stakes, but you get the idea.

With a small but dedicated team of five based in, well, let’s just say they have plenty of room to grow, they’re led by Group Partner Nicolas Dessaigne. Greenboard is already gaining traction, backed by reputable venture firms and trusted by clients managing billions in assets under management (AUM).

If you're interested in understanding how Greenboard can help your organization navigate the complex waters of financial compliance, they offer demo sessions for potential clients. For those looking to delve deeper into their offerings, I suggest visiting their [website](https://www.greenboard.com), where you can explore their solutions and request a demo.

In essence, Greenboard is not just a tool, but a transformative approach to compliance in financial services—a bold leap into the future that many firms are ready to embrace.
